description: From late Middle English, from Latin ventriculus (“the belly”), diminutive of venter (“the belly”). Doublet of ventriculus.

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy, zootomy) Any small cavity within a body; a hollow part or organ, especially:

entries.meaning: One of two lower chambers of the heart.
(neuroanatomy) One of four fluid-filled cavities in the brain, that are continuous with the central canal of the spinal cord.
examples: Meronyms: fourth ventricle, lateral ventricle, third ventricle
